comments:
The bugID is 
http://developer.java.sun.com/developer/bugParade/bugs/1266364.html.
	The problem is not easy to solve. Some character are illegal in a 
directory name. So there is a way to build a valid name (see JLS 7.2.1), but 
that causes some problems with
	the usage of forName().
	(11/26/99 11:14:34 AM)

	Philippe (11/29/99 11:47:31 AM)
		Ignore for the release. However we should fix it afterwards.

DA (6/25/01 6:16:55 PM)
	Step to reproduce in eclipse build 0.125.
		1) create a project P1.
		2) create class pkgs00702a.
			[public class pkgs00702a { 
			}]
		3) modify pkgs00702a in editor.
			[package javasoft.sqe.tests.lang.pkgs007.pkgs00702?;
 
			import java.io.PrintStream;

			public class pkgs00702a { 
			  static int r = 4; 
			  public static int get() {
		      		return r;
  			  }
			}]
		4) save and click yes to create the package.

		On file system a package directory are created but not with a ?.
		It is pkgs00702TM. (TM is the trademark character.)

DA (6/25/01 6:27:27 PM)
		To create package directory, mkdir method of java.io.File are 
use.
		This method can't create a package with ?, but it can with the 
unicode character u0099.
		In this case the trademark replace u0099.
Not critical since part of the exclude list and due to OS bug.
